intro: Goniolimon griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's goniolimon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Goniolimon griffithii is native to regions of Central Asia and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
